verses.roman:
udāsīnā vayaṁ nūnaṁ
na stry-apatyārtha-kāmukāḥ
ātma-labdhyāsmahe pūrṇā
gehayor jyotir-akriyāḥ

synonyms: udāsīnāḥ—indifferent; vayam—We; nūnam—indeed; na—not; strī—for wives; apatya—children; artha—and wealth; kāmukāḥ—hankering; ātma-labdhyā—by being self-satisfied; āsmahe—We remain; pūrṇāḥ—complete; gehayoḥ—to body and home; jyotiḥ—like a fire; akriyāḥ—engaged in no activity.
translation: We care nothing for wives, children and wealth. Always satisfied within Ourselves, We do not work for body and home, but like a light, We merely witness.
